description.narrative: 33 ASWA member organisations, 3 ASWA staff and #@ sex worker leaders (for Academy)

ASWA advocates for changes in social norms, laws and policies at the regional and international level (strategic goal in 2017-2020). ASWA has trained sex workers in Nigeria, Kenya, Mozambique, Angola, Namibia, Rwanda, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Tanzania and Uganda under our Champions Program, building their knowledge on regional human rights mechanisms such as the African Commission on Human and Peoples Rights and global reporting tools such as the Universal Period Review and the Convention on the Elimination of all Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW). Due to criminalisation of sex work in the African countries, these mechanisms offer the best avenues for sex workers to hold their governments accountable. Advocacy in these spaces is still critical. To enable, sex workers to meaningfully engage, there is need to continue building their capacity and skills to report and also advocate for changes in laws and policies that discriminate against the community. ASWA has four strategic goals to: • Advocate for changes to laws and polices at the regional and international levels • Strengthen the skills and knowledge of the African sex workers movement • Build a strong and resilient organisation • Learn from our activities and adapt our work based on gained knowledge This is in line with BtGs Theory of Change of a strengthened civil society that hold Governments, increased fulfilment of human rights of Key Populations

ASWA is currently developing the strategic plan based on National SW organisations' priorities for advocacy in the region. The organisation closely wsorks with NSWP in the support of SW organisations and the representation of SW in the global and regional platforms, like the AU, UNAIDS, Global Fund, WHO etc.
The organisation is currently building it's internal strength and coordinating and capacity building role for national sex worker network, including it's 33 member organisations.

sector.narrative: ASWA African Sex Work Alliance Social mitigation of HIV/AIDS
